Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 37th overall pick, by Texas in 1967...
Earned first career win on 9/9/1970...
Won World Series with Texas in 1972...
Traded from Texas to Philadelphia on 2/10/1978 (Going to PHI: P L. Colson. Going to TEX: SS R. Smalley III)...
Signed as a free agent by Boston on 2/4/1980 to a 3-year deal worth $3,500,000 per year...
Injured on 5/25/1980 with a Torn Rotator Cuff Muscle, out for full season...
Signed as a free agent by Texas on 2/6/1983 to a 2-year deal worth $6,995,000 per year...
Signed as a free agent by Chicago (N) on 4/1/1985 to a 1-year deal worth $772,000 per year...
Drafted in 1st round, 13th overall pick, by St. Louis in 1987...
Injured on 5/26/1989 with a Ruptured Bicep Tendon, out for 5 weeks...
Traded from St. Louis to Minnesota on 5/5/1993 (Going to STL: 1B P. O'Neill, P A. Rincon. Going to MIN: RF J. Burnitz, P J. Shaw, P S. Takatsu, P P. Harnisch)...
Earned first career win on 9/2/1994...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/14/1997, winning 2 games with a 0.53 ERA...
